am-i-my-brother's-keeper.context: Cain responds to God's inquiry about Abel's whereabouts after the murder.

my-punishment-is-greater.context: Cain's reaction to God's punishment for killing Abel.
my-punishment-is-greater.english: My punishment is greater than I can bear.

i-shall-be-a-fugitive.context: Cain expressing his fear of being killed after his banishment
i-shall-be-a-fugitive.hebrew: הֵן גֵּרַשְׁתָּ אֹתִי הַיּוֹם מֵעַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה וּמִפָּנֶיךָ אֶסָּתֵר וְהָיִיתִי נָע וָנָד בָּאָרֶץ וְהָיָה כָל מֹצְאִי יַהַרְגֵּנִי
i-shall-be-a-fugitive.english: Behold, You have driven me this day from the face of the earth; and from Your face I will be hidden, and I will be a vagrant and a wanderer on the earth, and whoever finds me will kill me.
